entry.title: Test cases for signing legacy inputs in transactions
entry.summary: Ali expresses concerns about relying solely on his own generated Core transactions for testing purposes. He acknowledges the correctness of Core's transaction implementation but highlights a significant limitation. The transactions he generates may not encompass all possible edge cases, which is crucial for thorough testing and validation. This acknowledgment underlines the importance of diverse testing scenarios to ensure comprehensive coverage and reliability in transaction processing.
